mcqs.question: Which of the following is a valid way to add a comment in HTML?
mcqs.explanation: `<!-- This is a comment -->` is the correct syntax for comments in HTML.

mcqs.question: Can HTML comments be seen in the browser's rendered webpage?
options: No, only in the page source
mcqs.explanation: Comments are not rendered visually but can be seen by viewing the page source.

mcqs.question: Which is a correct use of an HTML comment to temporarily remove a section of code?
mcqs.explanation: You can comment out code by wrapping it in `<!-- ... -->`.

mcqs.question: Is the following a valid HTML comment? `<!--- Extra dash --->`
mcqs.explanation: Too many dashes (`<!---`) at the start are not valid for standard HTML comments.

mcqs.question: Can you place a comment between attributes in an HTML tag?
options: No, it will break the tag
mcqs.explanation: A comment inside a tag's attribute list is invalid and will break the tag.

mcqs.question: Which shortcut key is commonly used in code editors to add a comment in HTML?
mcqs.explanation: `Ctrl + /` is a common shortcut for toggling comments in many code editors.

mcqs.question: What happens if you use nested HTML comments?
options: The first closing `-->` ends the comment
mcqs.explanation: HTML does not support nested comments; the first `-->` closes the comment.

mcqs.question: What is the main purpose of HTML comments?
mcqs.explanation: Comments are used for documentation and notes in source code.

mcqs.question: Can HTML comments contain other HTML tags?
options: Yes, but they are ignored by the browser
mcqs.explanation: Tags inside comments are not rendered or executed.

mcqs.question: What is the correct way to write an empty HTML comment?
mcqs.explanation: `<!-- -->` is the recommended empty comment in HTML.

mcqs.question: Is the following a valid HTML comment? `<!--This is a comment-->`
mcqs.explanation: Spaces are optional; `<!--This is a comment-->` is perfectly valid.

mcqs.question: Do HTML comments increase the page's load time?
options: No, they are ignored by the browser
mcqs.explanation: Browsers ignore comments; their effect on load time is negligible unless extremely large.

mcqs.question: Can comments be used to hide code from browsers that do not support JavaScript?
options: Yes, it was a common practice
mcqs.explanation: HTML comments were once used to hide scripts from old browsers.

mcqs.question: What happens if you use `<!--` without a closing `-->`?
options: The rest of the page is commented out
Only the first line is commented
mcqs.explanation: Without a closing `-->`, the rest of the page may be treated as commented out.

mcqs.question: Are HTML comments visible in browser developer tools?
options: Yes, in the Elements or Inspector tab
Only for comments longer than 50 characters
mcqs.explanation: Comments are visible in the Elements/Inspector tab of browser developer tools.

mcqs.question: Is this a valid HTML comment? `<!-- Comment --!>`
mcqs.explanation: The correct closing is `-->`, not `--!>`.

mcqs.question: What is the effect of placing a comment before the `<!DOCTYPE>` declaration?
options: Browsers may switch to quirks mode
The comment will not be visible
mcqs.explanation: A comment before `<!DOCTYPE>` can cause browsers to render in quirks mode.

mcqs.question: Which of the following is the main benefit of using comments in HTML?
mcqs.explanation: Comments help make the code clearer to developers.

mcqs.question: Are comments required to be on their own line in HTML?
mcqs.explanation: Comments can appear anywhere in the code, even inline.

mcqs.question: Can you use comments to describe the structure of an HTML page?
options: Yes, and it's a good practice
No, comments are only for code
mcqs.explanation: Using comments to describe sections and structure is a recommended practice.
